children.text: The exhaust fans installed in the wet areas ventilate into the roof, however the roof does not have any ventilation (sheet roof and/or roof sarking installed), and there has not been a whirly-bird roof ventilator installed.
he NCC’s Building Code of Australia (BCA) states in section 3.8.7.3 - Flow rate and discharge of exhaust systems, that
‘Exhaust from a bathroom, sanitary compartment, or laundry must be discharged;
directly or via a shaft or duct to outdoor air; or
to a roof space that is ventilated in accordance with 3.8.7.4’
Section 3.8.7.4 - Ventilation of roof spaces, states that
‘Where an exhaust system covered by 3.8.7.3 discharges into a roof space, the roof space must be ventilated to outdoor air through evenly distributed openings’ .
The builder must install the roof ventilator or alternatively have all exhaust fans ducted externally.
